text: The Coastal GasLink project is a 670-kilometre pipeline that will deliver natural gas from northeastern B.C. to the LNG Canada liquefaction facility in Kitimat.
The Coastal GasLink pipeline is a project of TC Energy who was selected by LNG Canada to design, build and operate the pipeline.
Preliminary work commenced in early 2019, with mainline pipeline construction to begin in 2020. The pipeline is scheduled to go into service in 2023.
